intro: Claytonia czukczorum, commonly known as the Alaskan pink, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink or red flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in alpine and tundra environments.
